Ramanand Hegde wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I have a test case class with 2 methods in it.
> In one test method I initialize a private member variable.
> In the other I try to use it.

Each test runs in a separate object, so setting instance variables does 
not allow you to write data from one test and read it from another.

<snip />
> Does junit initialize all member variables to null between tests?
> If so, how can I avoid it? I tried to implement blank setUp() and
> tearDown() methods, but that did not work.

Why do you want to do write data from one test and read it from another? 
This goes against the basic JUnit philosophy of test isolation.
